page.title: 14Roseberry Topping,Gt.Ayton.
page.content: Roseberry Topping stands ,320 metres above sea level.In 1912 the peak collapsed because of ironstone mining underneath.People think that this would have happened naturally anyway. Rocks still fall,and there are still worries that it will fall down completely in a few years time. Originally Roseberry Topping might have been called{Odinsbergh} (the hill of the God,Odin).Odinsbergh may have changed over the years to Oseberry which is easier to say.On the top of Roseberry Topping stands a stone post used for making surveys of the surrounding country-side. As you climb Roseberry Topping you will see a small tower called the {Shooting Lodge.}Built on the diagonal slope of Roseberry Topping,the tower is made from{whinstone.}Lots of visitors enjoy climbing the hill.
